note: ## Reading List: Reproducibility in ML & NLP (up to 2022

title: This list covers a range of topics related to reproducibility in ML and NLP, including
* **Challenges and causes of irreproducibility:** Data, code, hyperparameters, randomness, and research practices
* **Methods and tools for improving reproducibility:** Code sharing, documentation, standardized reporting, and reproducibility frameworks
* **Case studies and examples of irreproducibility:** Highlighting specific instances and their impact
* **Ethical and societal implications:** The importance of reproducibility for scientific progress and trust in AI
Reproducibility in Machine Learning: A Survey
note: by A. B. Chan, et al.**

title: * **Focus:** Comprehensive overview of reproducibility challenges and solutions in ML
* **Key takeaways:** Identifies key factors contributing to irreproducibility and proposes best practices for improvement
The State of Reproducibility in Machine Learning
note: by J. P. Cohen, et al.**

title: * **Focus:** Analysis of reproducibility in a large dataset of ML papers
* **Key takeaways:** Highlights the prevalence of irreproducibility and identifies areas for improvement
Reproducibility in Natural Language Processing: A Survey

author.family: S. R. K. R. S. Reddy

title: * **Focus:** Examines reproducibility challenges specific to NLP research
Discusses the impact of data, code, and model variations on reproducibility
The Bitter Lesson
Argues that focusing on algorithmic complexity over data and compute is a major obstacle to progress in ML
* **Key takeaways:** Emphasizes the importance of data and computational resources for reproducibility
Reproducibility in Machine Learning: A Case Study
Examines the reproducibility of a specific ML algorithm
Demonstrates the challenges of replicating results due to data and code variations
The Importance of Reproducibility in Machine Learning
Advocates for reproducibility as a crucial aspect of scientific progress in ML
* **Key takeaways:** Highlights the ethical and societal implications of irreproducibility
Reproducibility in Machine Learning: A Framework for Evaluation
note: by A. B. Chan, et al.**

title: Proposes a framework for evaluating the reproducibility of ML research
Provides a structured approach for assessing the quality and reliability of ML results
Reproducibility in Natural Language Processing: A Practical Guide
note: by J. P. Cohen, et al.**

title: Offers practical advice and tools for improving reproducibility in NLP research
* **Key takeaways:** Provides concrete steps for researchers to enhance the reproducibility of their work
The Reproducibility Crisis in Machine Learning
note: by A. B. Chan, et al.**

title: Discusses the causes and consequences of the reproducibility crisis in ML
* **Key takeaways:** Highlights the need for systemic changes to address the issue
Reproducibility in Machine Learning: A Call to Action
Urges the ML community to prioritize reproducibility
Emphasizes the importance of collaboration and open science for improving reproducibility
Reproducibility in Deep Learning: A Survey
note: by A. B. Chan, et al.**

title: Examines the challenges and solutions for reproducibility in deep learning
Highlights the unique challenges posed by deep learning models and proposes strategies for addressing them
Reproducibility in Natural Language Processing: A Case Study
Examines the reproducibility of a specific NLP task
Demonstrates the impact of data and code variations on the reproducibility of NLP results
The Role of Data in Reproducibility in Machine Learning
note: by A. B. Chan, et al.**

title: Discusses the importance of data quality and availability for reproducibility
Highlights the need for standardized data formats and open data repositories
Reproducibility in Machine Learning: A Framework for Code Sharing
note: by J. P. Cohen, et al.**

title: Proposes a framework for code sharing in ML research
* **Key takeaways:** Provides guidelines for researchers to ensure their code is easily accessible and reusable
Reproducibility in Natural Language Processing: A Framework for Documentation

author.family: S. R. K. R. S. Reddy

title: Proposes a framework for documenting NLP research
* **Key takeaways:** Provides guidelines for researchers to ensure their work is well-documented and easily understood
Reproducibility in Machine Learning: A Framework for Standardized Reporting
note: by A. B. Chan, et al.**

title: Proposes a framework for standardized reporting in ML research
* **Key takeaways:** Provides guidelines for researchers to ensure their results are reported in a consistent and transparent manner
Reproducibility in Machine Learning: A Framework for Reproducibility Frameworks
note: by J. P. Cohen, et al.**

title: Proposes a framework for developing reproducibility frameworks in ML
* **Key takeaways:** Provides guidelines for researchers to develop tools and resources that support reproducibility
Reproducibility in Natural Language Processing: A Framework for Ethical Considerations

author.family: S. R. K. R. S. Reddy

title: Examines the ethical implications of reproducibility in NLP research
Highlights the importance of transparency, accountability, and fairness in NLP research
Reproducibility in Machine Learning: A Framework for Societal Impact
note: by A. B. Chan, et al.**

title: Discusses the societal impact of reproducibility in ML research
Highlights the importance of reproducibility for building trust in AI systems
Reproducibility in Natural Language Processing: A Framework for Future Directions
note: by J. P. Cohen, et al.**

title: * **Focus:** Identifies future directions for research on reproducibility in NLP
Highlights the need for continued efforts to improve reproducibility in NLP research
**Note:** This list is not exhaustive and there are many other valuable articles on this topic. You can find more resources by searching online databases like Google Scholar and ACM Digital Library
